alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 17 at 12:04PM MDT until March 17 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Northerly winds gusting as high as 40 mph may lead to some blowing snow. * WHERE...Kit Carson and Cheyenne Counties in Colorado. * WHEN...Until 3 PM MDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions. Affected routes include Interstate 70, Highway 385, and Highway 40. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light to moderate snow, heavy at times, has led to snow accumulations across eastern Colorado. Slippery road conditions and sudden, significant reductions in visibility are occurring, especially on Interstate 70 in Kit Carson County. Several accidents have been reported.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. If you can delay travel, do so as poor travel conditions, as well as several accidents, have been reported. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
